result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo K Nicoletopoulos

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

10:31 AM Defendant Angelo K Nicoletopoulos in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Angelo K Nicoletopoulos.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is waiting for a global offer.
Hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Angelo K Nicoletopoulos in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Angelo K Nicoletopoulos.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests a further proceedings date in about 45 days.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Affidavit of Service or Protective Order for defendant at Waukesha County Jail.
Hearing on August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:35 AM Defendant Angelo K Nicoletopoulos in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Angelo K Nicoletopoulos.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Richard Fredrick, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Tempelis.
Cross examination by attorney Menden.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on August 15, 2022
Protective Order

Proposed protective order
The original document was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 08-15-2022
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Angelo K Nicoletopoulos
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2022)
Prior: 1120 Arcadian Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

3:17 PM Defendant Angelo K Nicoletopoulos in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
